value.title: AI will take away lots of jobs. And we are nowhere near ready to replace them
value.excerpt: The government, said the committee, must start actively explaining how data is being used, rather than expect the public to find out. The report stressed that to enable a better deployment of AI, the government should urgently appoint a dedicated leader.

value.title: AI controlled a US military aircraft for the first time
value.excerpt: AI has controlled a US military aircraft for the first time, serving as a co-pilot aboard a U-2 spy plane in a milestone test for the Air Force.

value.title: Forecast 2021: Artificial Intelligence during COVID and beyond

value.title: Google AI ethics team demands changes after dismissal of renowned researcher
value.excerpt: It comes after executives admitted to losing the trust of employees amid the departure of renowned researcher Timnit Gebru.

value.title: Retired UW computer science professor embroiled in Twitter spat over AI ethics and ‘cancel culture’
value.excerpt: (UW Photo) The University of Washington computer science department denounced comments made online by a retired professor over a debate about AI ethics, Timnit Gebru’s controversial exit at Google, so-called “cancel culture,” and more. A heated back ...

value.title: Brain-controlled gaming exists, though ethical questions loom over the tech

value.title: From whistleblower laws to unions: How Google’s AI ethics meltdown could shape policy
value.excerpt: Unionization of AI ethics researchers and stronger whistleblower protections are being discussed two week after Google fired Timnit Gebru.

value.title: Healthcare AI Implementation For Emerging Markets: Lessons Learned From The U.S. And EU
value.excerpt: Emerging markets are at the cusp of implementing and developing their own framework for AI implementation in healthcare.

value.title: Moving AI ethics beyond guidelines
value.excerpt: This article first appeared as an op-ed in The Straits Times, 16 December 2020 The recent row over a leading researcher’s departure from Google raises questions about the role and remit of AI ethics team and the inadequacy of frameworks to deal with moral complexities.

value.title: Skylum launches Luminar AI, its AI photo editor
value.excerpt: Over the course of the last few years, Skylum made a name for itself with a set of photo-editing apps like Aurora HDR and Luminar. With Luminar AI, it is now launching a brand-new photo editor, starting at $79.

value.title: AI ethics: Learn the basics in this free online course
value.excerpt: It's time to think about the potential risks of artificial intelligence, instead of after something happens. This free online course about AI ethics is a good starting point.

value.title: Tonko bill to expand K-12 AI education passes in NDAA
value.excerpt: Congressman Paul Tonko, one of a handful of engineers currently serving in Congress, announced his Artificial Intelligence Education Act has passed the House as part of this year’s

value.title: How Rolls-Royce seeks to ensure the ethical integrity of its AI black boxes
value.excerpt: Royce has created a ‘five checks AI philosophy’ that aims to externally interrogate whether its AI systems are acting fairly.

value.title: How AI and machine learning moved forward in 2020
value.excerpt: AI and machine learning saw several steps forward in 2020, from the first beta of GPT-3, stricter regulation of AI technologies and conversations around bias.

value.title: Unbiased AI becomes mission-critical in 2021
value.excerpt: While data management becomes critical, recognizing how data annotators influence model bias will be paramount to success.

value.title: The Dark Side of Big Tech’s Funding for AI Research
value.excerpt: Timnit Gebru’s exit from Google is a powerful reminder of how thoroughly companies dominate the field, with the biggest computers and the most resources.

value.title: "It's just research" isn't good enough in AI Ethics -p
value.excerpt: There was a little bit of noise around some papers being rejected on ethical grounds at the NeurIPS 2020 Conference. The responses fell into two camps: It's just research and AI has implications, ethics matter I'd firmly put myself in the latter camp,

value.title: Google to examine the departure of a leading AI ethics researcher
value.excerpt: Google says it will examine the departure of a prominent Black female researcher in the field of ethics in artificial intelligence, whose recent, sudden exit has angered thousands of the company's employees and others in the tech and academic communities.

value.title: Columbia researchers find white men are the worst at reducing AI bias
value.excerpt: Columbia researchers find evidence that differences in gender among engineers plays a role in introducing bias into AI algorithms.

value.title: AI is not yet perfect, but it's on the rise and getting better with computer vision
value.excerpt: It can beat anyone at chess but can't recognize fountains. One professor talks about the promise of AI and computer vision.

value.title: The trouble with AI: Why we need new laws to stop algorithms ruining our lives
value.excerpt: Ethical guidelines are the only tool to date to control AI systems. They're not doing much for our rights, finds a new report.

value.title: Google AI researcher's exit sparks ethics, bias concerns
value.excerpt: Prominent artificial intelligence scholar Timnit Gebru helped improve Google's public image as a company that elevates Black computer scientists and questions harmful uses of AI technology.

value.title: Google AI Researcher Pushed Out Amid Ethics Concerns
value.excerpt: She examined the risks of computer systems that analyze huge language databases to create their own human-like text.

value.title: Google AI researcher’s exit sparks ethics, bias concerns

value.title: Google widely criticized after parting ways with a leading voice in AI ethics
value.excerpt: Many Google employees and others in the tech and academic communities are furious over the sudden exit from Google of a pioneer in the study of ethics in artificial intelligence—a departure they see as a failure by an industry titan to foster an environment supportive of diversity.

value.title: AI Weekly: In firing Timnit Gebru, Google puts commercial interests ahead of ethics
value.excerpt: With the firing of Timnit Gebru this week, Google implicitly signaled that it's willing to put commercial interests ahead of all else.

value.title: Google staff hit out at effort to 'silence' AI ethics leader
value.excerpt: More than 400 employees of the US firm signed a letter saying Timnit Gebru's departure was 'a moment of reckoning beyond Google'
